message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.GT

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category as the paper discusses the security implications of the selfish-mine strategy on the Bitcoin blockchain.
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is also likely as the paper studies the behaviour of a network of Bitcoin miners.
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is relevant as the paper considers the effect of propagation delay on the blockchain.
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is relevant as the paper studies the behaviour of a small pool of miners and the rest of the community.
- cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) is relevant as the paper uses a Markov model to track the contrasting states of belief about the blockchain.
